Reroll.__EMPTY: WIP Reroll Guide
Pre-registration rewards give us enough to roll at least 10 times immediately after tutorial.
It takes 30 crystals to roll 1x, and 300 crystals to roll 10x.
Your first free multi is GUARANTEED to give a random SINGLE 5☆. It won't give a 5☆ Protection unit though.
Pre-reg Rewards For Pulling
• 10x Recruit Tickets
• 5☆ Guaranteed Recruit Ticket (on the 3rd login day)
• 500x Magicrystals (through game release login bonus)
• 20x Stamina Recovery
• Rimuru's Sword
• [Character] Shuna, Pink Ogre of Heavenly Light
• 5x [Character] Rimuru, the Reincarnated Memory Stone
• [Character] Shuna, Pink Ogre of Heavenly Light Memory Stone
• 10x Small Grindstone
• 10x Nation of Monsters Hot Pot
• 100x Proof of Sworn Friendship
• 100x Tempest Coin
• 5x 4☆ Memory Stone Shard (Used for Limit Break)
5☆ battle units drop at 3% rate. 5☆ protection units drop at 1% rate. It may be beneficial to reroll for protection due to their lower drop rates.
After the initial free 10x multi, finish the remaining tutorial to pull with your 10x tickets. After a 5☆ protection unit is pulled, you can build a team around their passive.
Please check Reroll Combos for generally great rerolls.
To reroll, go title screen > menu > delete game data.

Tutorial Text.Tutorial Text from Game Files: Parallel Processing enables you to automatically clear a set number of quests while you do something else.
Note: Parallel Processing continues in the background even if you close the game.
If you want to clear quests more quickly, use a troop with more EP to shorten the time.
If you do not currently fulfill the requirements to do Parallel Processing, tap to see what you are missing.
Forged equipment can become stronger by leveling up.
When it reaches the max level, equipment can be evolved, which increases its rarity and raises the level up limit.
You can also reforge the equipment multiple times to raise its status as high as possible.
Use materials collected in the main story and events to forge equipment.
When you're low on materials, disassemble equipment that you no longer need for their materials.
Equipment produces an effect when equipped to characters.
When you're done forging a piece of equipment, don't forget to equip it.

Protection characters can use the skill Divine Protection, which has a permanent effect during battle, and also increase the status of all battle characters in both the vanguard and rearguard of your troop.
The stronger the protection character, the greater the status increase, so train them well.
Activating each type of soul increases a different gauge.
Fill up the Secret Skill Gauge with the Soul of Secrets. Use the gauge to unleash your Secret Skill.
You can make combos with every type of soul and do massive damage to the enemy, so don't hesitate to use them.
There are 3 types of souls that you can use against enemies in battle.
Choose cards of the same type or character and attack the enemy.
Use the 'Build Nation' function to develop the Goblin village into a town and then a nation.
As the town becomes more advanced, you'll earn Magicrystals and other useful rewards, such as Training Quests and larger party limits.
Building a Symbol of Protection will boost the stats of your protection characters.
Assigning protection characters to a Symbol will further increase its effect.
Construct a laboratory to produce healing potions at regular intervals.
Use healing potions to recover stamina so you can go on quests.
Construct magic devices to raise the stats for battle characters of each attribute.
There are 7 types of magic device: Fire, Water, Earth, Wind, Space, Light, and Dark.
Only protection characters can be appointed to magic devices. Doing so enhances the stat increases for battle characters.
Construct a Gold Coin Mint to get Gold Coins at regular intervals.
Gold Coins can be used to construct and level up facilities.
Construct a digsite to generate magistones at regular intervals.
Magistones are used to release abilities.
There are 5 types of magistone digsites: HP, Attack, Defense, Training, and Protection.
Construct buildings to increase your max number of Sworn Friends.
Request and approve Sworn Friends in the 'Other' menu.
By forming Sworn Friendships with other chancellors, you can request aid to shorten the construction time of facilities currently under construction.
Plus, when you send aid to a Sworn Friend, you receive Proofs of Sworn Friendship that can be used at the Bazaar. Form lots of Sworn Friendships and help out all your friends.
To raise up your Central Office past level 4, you need to increase your Total Facility Level.
Increase your population while constructing and levelling up buildings to expand your town and raise your Central Office Level.

Each time you level up your Central Office, you can further increase the size of your town, the amount of items you can collect, and your max population, as well as receive all sorts of other benefits.
When you request aid, your Sworn Friends can help you by shortening your facilities' construction time.
Tap a facility that is currently under construction or levelling up to bring up the menu and select 'Request Aid'.
When your Sworn Friends send aid, the construction time is shortened.
You can request aid from each Sworn Friend once per day.
Tap Rimuru on the Home screen to change between slime and human form.
Interact with citizens in your preferred form.
Each character has an attribute.
If you attack a character with an attribute that you have an advantage over, you will deal increased damage.
Pay attention to your enemies' attributes and choose characters wisely to deal more damage.
You can check attribute strengths and weaknesses during battle from the menu.
A combo is executed by selecting multiple souls and unleashing an attack. The higher the combo, the more damage each hit does, and the more each hit fills your gauge.
A four card combo or higher will increase damage.
A card combo of five or more will allow your characters to attack all at once.
If a speech balloon button appears over a townsperson when you approach, tap it to speak with them.
Stroll around town and speak with three different people.
Constructing a forge allows you to produce new equipment, enhance them, and disassemble them.
Equip your characters to increase their stats.
When you construct food facilities, they will produce food after a certain amount of time.
The food produced can be gifted to other characters in order to increase your bond.
Construct houses and increase your population.
Once your population reaches a certain level, you can level up your Mayor's House to 2.
By raising your Mayor's House to level 2, you can increase the size of your town, the amount of items you can collect, your max population, as well as all sorts of other benefits.
Further level up the Mayor's House to renovate it into the Central Office. This will expand your realm and greatly alter the appearance of your facilities.
When you complete a Bingo mission, you can receive an achievement reward, a line bingo reward, or a completion reward.
At the beginner Bingo, you can win a 5* battle character version of Shuna wearing a special outfit.
Note: If you already have a character, you will get character-specific memory stones.
Complete your bingo, awaken Shuna, and put her in your team!
You can accept requests from
different characters in the Quest List.
Fulfilling these requests will earn you rewards and increase your
Bond level with that character.
Characters will appear at random in the town.
You can approach and speak with them, thereby strengthening your bond with that character once per day.
Leveling up your Bond with a character provides increased stats and various other benefits.
Event quests are where you can take on quests that are available for a limited amount of time.
There are bits of story that you can only see in event quests, so be sure not to miss one!
Training Quests allow you to collect items and materials used to power up your characters.
Daily Quests can only be challenged once per day, but you can get a lot of enhancement materials using Predator. Be sure to check in and try them out every day.
Characters can be assigned to different facilities to increase their output.
Characters with a better affinity for a facility will enhance it more than others.
You can interact with a selected character.
Giving food items will increase your Bond level, providing stat boosts  and various other benefits.
You can also check the character's profile, and change their outfits by selecting Change Style.
Note: Some outfits can be worn during Interaction and on your home screen.
Set a rearguard character so that you can swap out members participating in a battle from the top right corner of the battle screen.
Select one character each from the vanguard and rearguard to swap places.
Once a character is moved to rearguard, that character cannot be swapped again until the turn ends.
Setting a rearguard character allows you to switch characters in the heat of battle.
Assign the max amount of characters to get the most firepower and take on difficult quests.
Set a support character to raise the
stats of your battle characters.
When the attributes of your  support characters and battle characters match, a Same Attribute Boost is applied and increases your stats further.
You can assign characters to your troop formation as you see fit by tapping a character and swapping places with another character.
The support slots and rearguard slots are unlocked as you increase the population of your town.
Use the 'Recommendation' button whenever you are unsure of how to set up your formation.
Select information to ask the Great Sage a question, and you will get an appropriate answer.
You can get helpful info about recommended quests, enhanceable characters, constructable facilities, and more.
You can ask the Great Sage at any time, so be sure to use this function to your advantage.
Raising a skill to a certain level causes it to evolve and increases its rarity.
-Lv. 1 to 3: Common Skills (Silver)
-Lv. 4 to 6: Extra Skills (Gold)
-Lv. 7 to 10: Unique Skills (Rainbow)
Each time a battle character's skill is evolved, the points required to activate the skill is reduced, making it easier to activate skills during battle.
Enhancement skills must have the same rarity as the skill they are used to enhance.
The more difficult a Predator quest, the more likely it is to reward you with enhancement skills with a high rarity.
Use materials obtained during training quests to obtain abilities, as well as raise character stats, power up Secret Skills, and enhance Divine Protection.
Each character has five levels of Ability Release, and releasing all the abilities at one level unlocks the next level.
You can unlock your level cap, as well as earn and strengthen traits by awakening characters.
When you awaken a character five times, it increases that character's rarity.
When you recruit characters, you can get character-specific memory and contract stones that can be used to awaken them
You can also get memory stone and contract stone shards from events.
As long as the character type (Battle/Protection) and rarity match the character, you can use these materials to awaken that character.

Most teams should have the following: 2-3 Main DPS, 1-2 Soul Converters, 1-2 Supports/(De)Buffers.  (Depending on Content and Team, not every team can or should follow this general rule.
CURRENTLY OUTDATED (if it has X CONQUEST as a title then it is up to date)
Change everything to Blue and buff it along with Ults.

Team Comps.__EMPTY_5: Milim Nava [One of Oldest Demon Lords]

The plan is to change everything to Blue and buff it with Rimuru for nice dmg, this will also allow you to spam your protector meaning loads of SS Gauge increases (which you will be buffing the dmg of those Ults with Milim) as well as even more changing Green to Blue and just repeating itself. You spam high dmg Blue Souls and high dmg Ults basically with this team. For Light Conquest though replace Rimuru for 3* Alice for the Stun. Might be able to do Expert without Stun.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_3: She is switched in when you are ready to buff Ults.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_4: She is switched in to convert Orange souls to Blue Souls.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_5: Can replace Dark Milim if you don't have her. Also converts Orange to Blue.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_6: Can replace Wind Milim as Veldora also buffs Ult. It is a weaker buff though.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_7: Can replace Dark Milim if you don't have her. Also converts Orange to Blue.
Team Comps.__EMPTY_8: Can replace DL Rimuru as Souei also buffs Blue souls. Is a weaker buff though starting out, better for very long fights.

Basically Ramiris with Gazel as the main DPS.

Team Comps.__EMPTY: Gazel Dwargo [King of an Armed Nation]
Team Comps.__EMPTY_5: Milim Nava [One of Oldest Demon Lords]

Light team w/ earth seems very defensive oriented as nearly every unit besides Gazel Dwargo use defensive or support skills/passives. Could make for an interesting counterattack team comp.
Basically Charybdis with Rimuru and/or units that use Space.
This team can accumulate skill souls fast. Rimuru supports the team with very thicc ATK and DEF buffs. Good balance of DPS and survivability and access to plenty of skill usage it seems.
Basically Ifrit with Benimaru or Shizue and fire/light supporters.

Team Comps.__EMPTY_2: Gazel Dwargo [King of an Armed Nation]

Team supports Benimaru or Shizue as they do the bulk of the damage. Gazel is another source of reliable DPS.

Team Comps.__EMPTY_2: Rimuru Tempest [Harmonizer of Monsters and Humans]

Kind of bizarre how every water unit and even Space Rimuru wants to boost your DEF. You'll need a good DPS with single target nuke on this team.
Basically Colossus with... any 5* Earth or Water lol

Pure Earth team seems to lack some damage. Very defensive. Colossus' skill super boosts team counterattack rate. Make sure you have Treyni or Rimuru [Harmonizer] for healing.

High DPS somewhat low sustain team comp. Plenty of units convert Soul of Skill into Soul of Secret. Not shown above, but Diablo and Veldora also works on this team.
